content.text: Determine the distance travelled by the cyclist between time \(= 0\) and time \(= 100\) s
distance travelled =   .........  \(m\)

Fig. 1.2 shows the cyclist riding along a long straight road
The speed of the cyclist is \(15 \text{m/s}\). Determine the velocity of the cyclist
velocity =   .........  m/s
direction
Fig. 1.1 shows a distance–time graph for a cyclist
Calculate the density of the metal. Include the unit
density =
The cylinder is falling at constant speed through the air. Fig. 2.1 shows the vertical forces acting on the cylinder
On Fig. 2.1, write the name and the size of the upward force on the cylinder

weight of block =   .........  N

Fig. 3.2

Fig. 3.3

Fig. 3.1

amplitude =   .........  \(cm\)

frequency =   .........  \(Hz\)

The arrows on the diagram show the directions of propagation of the wavefronts

Fig. 4.3 shows wavefronts changing direction as they pass from shallow water to deep water. The arrows on the diagram show the directions of propagation of the wavefronts
Fig. 4.1 represents a wave on the surface of water
Two of the regions are unlabelled
Add the correct label to each of the unlabelled regions in Fig. 5.1

infrared radiation
ultraviolet radiation
Describe possible harmful effects of excessive exposure to:
infrared radiation
ultraviolet radiation

output voltage =   .........  V
For transmission, the output voltage is increased to \(132\mathrm{kV}\)
State two advantages of transmitting electrical power at high voltage
Fig. 6.1 shows four wind turbines

F<sub>1</sub> and F<sub>2</sub> are the focal points of the lens and C is the centre of the converging lens

The arrangement is shown in Fig. 8.2

[Total: 7]

The chemical symbol for actinium is Ac
